intro: Glyceria distans var. minutula, commonly known as the slender watergrass, is a flowering plant species native to wetland environments in North America. It is a member of the Poaceae family, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its slender, tufted growth habit. The plant typically grows in shallow water or moist soil, often found in marshes, ponds, and along the edges of lakes. Its inflorescence consists of a panicle of small, spikelet-like flowers, which are wind-pollinated. Glyceria distans var. minutula plays an important ecological role in stabilizing wetland soils and providing habitat for aquatic invertebrates.
